text: Gerard van den Tweel (19 October 1944 – 14 January 2025) was a Dutch businessman. Van den Tweel was born in Nijkerk on 19 October 1944. Van den Tweel was supermarket entrepreneur and general manager of 1905 founded family business Konst BV. He was Albert Heijn franchiser and owned supermarkets on Curaçao and Bonaire. He was also honorary consul of Suriname. Van den Tweel was listed in the , an overview of the 500 richest Dutch people, with an estimated net worth of 265 million Euro. He was honored by Pope Franciscus in 2018. The same year he became an honorary citizen of the municipality of Nijkerk. Van den Tweel was diagnozed with bile duct cancer. He retired in early January 2025. He died on 14 January 2025, at the age of 80. ==References== Category:Dutch businesspeople Category:1944 births Category:2025 deaths Category:People from Gelderland Category:Place of death missing
title: Gerard van den Tweel
